author: Special Correspondent
text:
Security at Madurai airport has been tightened following the recent terrorist attack on Phathankot airbase in Punjab. While the Central Industrial Security Force stepped up its vigil in the airport area, the district police deployed armed police personnel in the outer periphery.

A police source said that six two-wheeler patrols, headed by an Inspector of Police, were deployed around the airport for round-the-clock sweeping patrolling. Besides, an armed striking force was deployed in the vicinity of the airport.

Two bomb detection and disposal squads were also posted there. In addition to the regular security duty, the CISF increased its patrolling in the funnel area to check unauthorised movement in the operational area. They have also enhanced vigil in the airport security area.

Baggage checking was intensified by the central paramilitary force.
title: Security up at Madurai airport
